stories.body:
If there's one company that exemplifies the opportunity represented by the accelerating adoption of artificial intelligence (AI),
 Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) is arguably that company.Its graphics processing units (GPUs) were already the gold standard for processing earlier versions of AI before generative AI burst on the scene early last year. These advancements required much greater computing horsepower than their predecessors, and Nvidia was there to answer the call, quickly becoming the go-to for running cutting-edge AI performance.The result has been a parabolic stock price move that's been nothing short of breathtaking. Nvidia soared 147% over the past year, notching gains of 478% over the past three years (as of this writing). One Wall Street analyst believes Nvidia has much further to rise, predicting the stock could generate additional gains of 259% by 2030. However, this same analyst believes that rival Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD) could soar even higher.Continue reading Weiter zum vollständigen Artikel bei MotleyFool
  Wenn Sie mehr über das Thema Aktien erfahren wollen, finden Sie in unserem Ratgeber viele interessante Artikel dazu!
  Jetzt informieren!
  Analysen zu NVIDIA Corp. mehr Analysen
   UBS AG
   Bernstein Research
   Jefferies & Company Inc.
   Bernstein Research
   DZ BANK

stories.body:
股市  Apple Intelligence的AI模型據報是在Google設計的處理器上進行預訓練  蘋果在周一為部分裝置釋出預覽版Apple Intelligence
 綜合外電報道，蘋果（Apple，美：AAPL）周一（29日）表示，支撐其人工智能AI系統Apple Intelligence的AI模型是在谷歌（Google）設計的處理器上進行預先訓練，反映大型科技公司正在尋找替代英偉達（NVIDIA，美：NVDA）芯片的方案。
  蘋果最新釋出的一份技術文件詳細介紹使用Google本土張量處理單元（Tensor Processing Unit，TPU）進行訓練。另外，蘋果在周一為部分裝置釋出預覽版Apple Intelligence。
  Nvidia GPU供不應求
  Nvidia昂貴圖形處理單元（GPU）一直佔據高階AI訓練芯片市場主導地位，在過去的幾年裡，需求量極之高，以至於很難採購所需數量。 OpenAI、微軟（Microsoft，美：MSFT）和 Anthropic 都在使用 Nvidia的 GPU 來建立他們的模型，而其他科技公司，包括 Google、Meta（美：META）、Oracle（美：ORCL） 和 Tesla（美：TSLA），則著加發展自家AI系統及產品。
  Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg和Alphabet（美: GOOGL） CEO Sundar Pichai上周都表示，他們的公司和該行業的其他人可能對AI基礎設施過度投資，但承認不這樣做的業務風險太高。Zuckerberg 曾受訪時稱，落後的風險是，你在未來 10 到 15 年最重要的技術中處於失勢位置。
  用Cloud TPU 集群訓練
  蘋果在其 47 頁的文件中沒有提及 Google 或 Nvidia，但指出了其蘋果基礎模型 (AFM) 和 AFM 伺服器是在「Cloud TPU 集群」上進行訓練，意味著蘋果租用雲服務提供商的伺服器來執行計算。蘋果在文件中說：「這個系統使我們能夠高效和可擴展地訓練 AFM 模型，包括 AFM-on-device、AFM-server 和更大的模型」
  周一蘋果推出Apple Intelligence測試版，該系統包括幾個新功能，如Siri重新整理外觀、更好的自然語言處理和文字欄位中AI生成的摘要。
  明年，蘋果計劃推出基於生成式AI的功能，包括影象生成、表情符號生成和可以訪問使用者個人資訊並在應用程式內採取行動的Powered Siri。
  Google 亦有用Nvidia 芯片
  蘋果在文件中表示，AFM on-device 是在一個由 2048 個 TPU v5p 芯片組成的「切片」上進行訓練，根據文件，AFM-server 是在 8192 個 TPU v4 芯片上進行訓練，這些芯片配置在一起作為數據中心網絡中的八個切片。
  根據 Google 的網站，最新的 TPU 在預先訂購三年的每小時使用成本不到 2 美元，谷歌於 2015 年首次推出其 TPU 用於內部工作負載，並於 2017 年向公眾提供，儘管如此，Google 是Nvidia 的大型客戶之一，公司在培訓AI系統時使用 Nvidia 的 GPU 和自家的 TPU，同時還在其雲平台上銷售對 Nvidia 技術的訪問權。
  蘋果此前表示，推理，即運行已預先訓練的AI模型以生成內容或進行預測，將部分在其自家芯片的數據中心上進行。
  SearchGPT｜OpenAI與Google正面交鋒 推AI搜尋功能「SearchGPT」 冀補ChatGPT哪短板？
  分析｜Google為何業績優但股價急挫？
  看文章 ・ 賺取 ET Points
  hket會員只要做齊報價專區任務並儲夠積分，就可以兌換高達$3000優惠券

stories.title: 美股焦點｜蘋果據報使用Google芯片訓練AI模型

en.body:
The Apple Intelligence model is based on Google's design of a training tool, which was released on Monday for part of Apple Intelligence.
Apple Intelligence's AI model, designed by Google, reflects the fact that big technology companies are looking for alternative UK chips, according to Apple, an AI model that runs through its artificial intelligence AI system, according to the Apple, 
A recent technical paper on the development of the Tensor Processing Unit, the PTU, was introduced in detail. In addition, Miango released Apple Intelligence for part of the game on Monday.
Nvidia GPU's non-request
Nvidia yung-o-o-geoform (GPU) has been the leader in high-level AI chip market, and in the past years demand has been extremely high and the amount of weight needed to buy is difficult. OpenAI, Microsoft, MSFT and Anthropic are using Nvidia's GPU to build their models, while other technology companies, including Google, Meta (US: META), Oracle (US: ORCL) and Tesla (US: TSLA), are developing their own AI and products.
Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai said last week that their companies and others concerned could invest in infrastructure in the AI base but that the business conditions that do not do so are too high. And the wind that was lost was that you lost your position in the most important technology of 10 to 15 years.
Training in the Cloud PTU cluster
In its document 47, Mémégo did not mention Google or Nvidia, but noted its base model (ARM) and AFM servo in training on the Cloud PTU cluster, meaning that the service providers hired the mermaids to perform the calculation. And MYYO said in the document, "This system allows us to train the AFM model with a high efficiency and scale, including AFM-on-dvice, AFM-server and larger models."
The Apple Intelligence test version, which features several new features, such as Siri's re-ordering of tactile, better natural language and a summary of AI in the text-positioning section, was introduced Monday.
Next year, MYM will launch its own AI-based function, including image generation, facial expression generation and personal user-driven Googled Siri, which is a user-friendly application-driven action.

Google's Web site, the latest TPU, used less than $2 per day in the three-year period, and Google first launched its TPU in 2015 to provide public access to public service in 2017, and Google is a large company in N

stories.body:
Business Microsoft’s goal this week: Reassure Wall St.

The pressure is on Mister Softee, otherwise known as Microsoft (MSFT) , when the software giant reports earnings after Tuesday's market close.

The reason: Investors are starting to ask a question basic to any company spending millions — or, more likely, billions — on artificial intelligence investments: When will we start to see real returns from all that spending?

What can't happen is the AI investing goes on and doesn't show any profits.

Related: Analyst revamps Amazon stock forecast before earnings

"Investors will be very focused on Microsoft's ability to continue to accelerate revenue growth, especially the portion related to AI. If revenue acceleration doesn't materialize and increases in capex continue, investors may be disappointed," Gil Luria, senior software analyst at D.A. Davidson, told Reuters this week.

So, the goal of Microsoft and CEO Satya Nadella after Tuesday's close is to show there is a "there" there on its huge bet on AI. The stock closed Monday at $426.73, up 1.5% on the day and up 13.5% so far in 2024.

But the share price has fallen back 8.9% from its peak price of $468.35 on July 5. To be fair, it was probably unlikely Microsoft shares would perform as they did in 2023, rising 53.6%.

You might see an acknowledgement of that "there" Tuesday. The company is expected to report fiscal-fourth quarter revenue of $64.2 billion, up about 14% from a year ago but down from 17% in the fiscal third quarter, which ended at the end of March. Earnings, estimated at $2.90 a share, would be up about 8% from a year ago.

AI is a growing piece of Microsoft's biggest business

The AI question will come up when in the revenue reported for Microsoft's intelligent Cloud business. Microsoft's largest business group, the business includes its cloud computing applications and other technologies. And AI is central to the future of the business.

In the year ago quarter, Microsoft said the Cloud business grew 15% to $24 billion. Later, the company said 7% of that growth was due to AI. In addition Microsoft said it spent $10.7 billion to support "demand in our cloud and AI offerings."

Meanwhile, Microsoft has invested $13 billion in Open AI, the startup that's done a lot of the early work on AI, and Microsoft is prepared to invest more.

So, the question will fall on how much Microsoft's cloud business will grow this year and whether the percentage of that growth due to AI is larger than a year ago.

A Samsung laptop with Microsoft Copilot+ PC at a Best Buy store in Union City, Calif.Bloomberg/Getty Images Bloomberg/Getty Images

Many investors will look for revenue growth of substantially more than 15% and a bigger-than-a-year ago contribution from AI.

One can expect more questions around these numbers when the company holds its analyst call at 2:30 p.m. PT (5:30spp p.m. ET). Nadella and Chief Financial Officer Amy Hood will be on the call.

A shortfall may spook investors. The unease is due to the market frenzy for all things AI in the first half of 2024 that ultimately spawned worries tech shares were rising too darn fast.

By June 18, Nvidia (NVDA) shares were up as much as 174% on the year. Too much for many shareholders who decided to lock in profits. The shares have since slipped 17.6%.

More Tech Stocks:

A miss can cost you

Alphabet (GOOGL) shares have fallen 6.7% since its July 23 earnings release because of the AI spending worry. (But some analysts and writers, including Barrons' Bill Alpert, have said the selling was a big mistake.)

Microsoft remains a staggeringly profitable company with a net profit margin of 35%. Many of its businesses, such as its Office products, are run as subscription services with high rates of renewals. Its sales of Windows software to personal-computer makers have been volatile.

If there is an issue, Luria says, it's slower growth in its personal computing business that includes Windows and the Xbox gaming division. The productivity business — home to the Office suite of apps, LinkedIn and 365 Copilot — is expected to post growth of about 10%.

This is a huge week for tech earnings overall. Chip maker Advance Micro Devices (AMD) also reports Tuesday. Facebook-parent Meta Platforms (META) , chip-design Arm Holdings (ARM) , and chip maker QUALCOMM (QCOM) are up Wednesday, with Apple (AAPL) , Amazon.com (AMZN) and Intel (INTC) set for Thursday.

Related: Veteran fund manager sees world of pain coming for stocks

The Arena Media Brands, LLC THESTREET is a registered trademark of TheStreet, Inc.

stories.body:
The Tesla CEO had some kind words for Nvidia.  This article was originally published on Fool.com . All figures quoted in US dollars unless otherwise stated.
 At this point, Nvidia NASDAQ: NVDA ) needs no introduction. Almost everyone probably knows the artificial intelligence (AI) leader by now.
  Nvidia stock has exploded over the last year and a half, and even briefly earned the title of the world's most valuable company, surpassing perennial tech titans Apple and Microsoft to top the charts.
  The company dominates the market for data center graphics processing units (GPUs), the semiconductor components used to run powerful AI models like ChatGPT, with an estimated market share of 98% in 2023.
  However, virtual monopolies in fast-growing markets tend to attract competition, and that's just what's happening to Nvidia. AMD and Intel have both launched their own competing AI GPUs, and even some of the smart money seems to think Nvidia stock could be due for a breather.
  Stanley Druckenmiller, who posted an average annual return of 30% in more than two decades running Duquesne Capital Management, cut nearly all of his Nvidia stake in the first quarter, believing that AI stocks may have gotten too hot. Other billionaire fund managers like Steve Cohen of Point72 and Millennium Management's Israel Englander have also dumped shares of Nvidia.
  However, one billionaire investor, Tesla CEO Elon Musk, sounds downright bullish on Nvidia. Comments he made about Nvidia in Tesla's recent earnings call should reassure Nvidia investors who might be worried about competition.
  Nvidia's demand is still off the charts
  Tesla, which is focused on building autonomous vehicles and autonomous robots, is one of the biggest buyers of AI hardware. Musk's other companies, such as X and xAI, are also buying Nvidia's components.
  On Tesla's recent earnings call, Musk underscored the need for Nvidia's products, saying in response to a question on Tesla's Dojo supercomputer:
  Yes. So Dojo, I should preface this by saying I'm incredibly impressed by Nvidia's execution and the capability of their hardware. And what we are seeing is that the demand for Nvidia hardware is so high that it's often difficult to get the GPUs. And there just seems this — I guess I'm quite concerned about actually being able to get [unclear] Nvidia GPUs when we want them.
  In other words, despite AMD and Intel having launched their competing products (the MI300 and Gaudi 3, respectively) months ago, there's no sign that they are having a meaningful impact on Nvidia's control of the data center GPU market. Demand for Nvidia's products still remains extraordinarily high and shortages continue. Musk also noted that the price for Nvidia's GPUs has soared due to unmet demand for the products. That doesn't mean that competitors like AMD and Intel won't eventually take market share from Tesla, but according to Musk's commentary, so far Nvidia's monopoly is intact.
  What it means for Nvidia stock
  While Nvidia is likely to face more competition, it's a mistake to think that its products are commodities that can be easily replicated by its rivals.
  Musk's remark that he is "incredibly impressed by Nvidia's execution and the capability of their hardware" also shouldn't be overlooked. After all, Musk, who was also a co-founder of OpenAI, is in as good a position as anyone else to assess the AI landscape, and he's not in the habit of doling out compliments to would-be competitors just to be nice.
  For Nvidia, Musk's comments are a reminder that the company's blistering growth is likely to go on, especially as it continues to push the envelope with its new Blackwell platform to stay ahead of the competition.
  It's understandable that investors would fear a pullback in a stock that has run so far so fast, but Nvidia is safer than the bears think. Not only is demand for its product still outpacing supply nearly two years after ChatGPT launched, but the stock itself looks reasonably priced. It's trading at a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) of 40, which is cheaper than Musk's Tesla and AMD, and only modestly more expensive than Intel, which is expected to report negative revenue this year.
  Considering Musk's comments and its entrenched advantages in GPUs, it's still not too late to buy Nvidia stock.
  This article was originally published on Fool.com . All figures quoted in US dollars unless otherwise stated.

stories.title: Thinking of buying Nvidia stock? You need to hear what Elon Musk just said!

stories.body:
（纽约30日讯）美债息短升长跌，债息倒挂扩阔，金龙指数、道指下跌，标指纳指连升两日。市场观望美英日央行议息政策，美股上升，美股向小型股轮动的势头暂歇，投资者等待微软、Meta等发布业绩。Tesla上涨，摩根士丹利将该公司列为首选美国汽车股。
 花旗将中国2024年经济增速预测从5%下调至4.8%，理由是经济势头变差，政策帮助有限。
  截至7月26日的一周，投资者从重仓中国股票的Vanguard FTSE新兴市场ETF撤出5.06亿美元，规模为四年来最大。iShares安硕MSCI中国ETF单周资金流出量创纪录最高。富达旗下一只规模近百亿美元的新兴市场基金6月清仓阿里巴巴（9988）港股，建仓京东ADR，增持台积电。
  道琼斯工业平均指数收跌49点，跌幅0.13%，报40539点。标普500指数收涨4点，升幅0.09%，报5463点。纳斯达克综合指数收涨12点，或0.08%，报17370点。
  高盛跌1.26%，报492.72美元(下同)，是拖累道指跌幅最大的蓝筹，拖累41点，而麦当劳升3.74%，报261.42元，贡献道指61点。
  科技股方面，苹果(美：AAPL)收市报218.24元，升0.12%，谷歌母公司Alphabet(美：GOOGL)收市报169.53元，升1.51%，亚马逊(美：AMZN)收市报183.2元，升0.38%，Facebook母公司Meta(美：META)收市报465.71元，升0%，英伟达(美：NVDA)收市报111.59元，跌1.3%，微软(美：MSFT)收市报426.73元，升0.34%，Tesla (美：TSLA)收市报232.1元，升5.59%。
  欧洲STOXX 600指数收跌0.21%，报511点。德国DAX指数收跌0.53%，报18320点；法国CAC 40指数跌0.99%，报7443点；英国富时100指数收涨0.09%，报8292点。（香港明报）

stories.body:
巴伦周刊  ·  降息只是有可能破坏 “小盘股之夏”的因素之一。  “大轮动”(Great Rotation)下的美国股市正在发生变化，不过，这种趋势是否会持续下去？还是说大型科技股重返巅峰只是时间问题？
 7月早些时候，英伟达(NVDA)等超大盘股的突然回落拖累主要股指大幅下挫，与此同时，小盘股、对利率变化较为敏感的防御性股票和金融股等价值股出现反弹。
  小盘股指数罗素2000、中盘股指数标普中盘股400指数以及道琼斯工业平均指数等以价值为导向的指数跑赢标普500指数和纳斯达克综合指数，并且创下多年来最大跑赢幅度，“大轮动”初见端倪。
  “小盘股之夏”，
  在那之后，从某种程度上来说“大轮动”仍在持续。道琼斯市场数据(Dow Jones Market Data)显示，在截至7月23日的10个交易日里，罗素2000跑赢标普500指数10.8个百分点，是有记录以来跑赢幅度最大的10天。
  上周，标普500指数下跌0.8%，纳指下跌2.1%，道指上涨 0.75%，标普小盘股600指数上涨3.6%。
  上周美股走势
  美股“大轮动”的受益者是否能守住最近的涨幅、或者进一步走高，取决于以下三个因素。
  美联储降息的原因
  今年夏季到来之前，领涨股市的股票似乎即将发生变化：大型科技股和其他超大盘股已经变得很贵，小盘股、中盘股和价值股则非常便宜。
  但Glenmede负责投资策略的副总裁迈克·雷诺兹(Mike Reynolds)指出，当时“大轮动”需要一个催化剂。6月美国CPI数据于7月11日公布后，投资者上调了对美联储未来一年降息次数的预期。
  根据芝加哥商品交易所集团(CME Group)的数据，交易员们现在认为，2025年8月之前，美联储有很大可能会降息六次。
  过去一个月降息预期大幅升温，
  美联储是否真的会降息这么多次，可能会在年底前对小盘股产生深远影响，不过，重要的不仅仅是降息的次数，降息的原因也很重要。
  雷诺兹说：“美联储降息的原因很重要，如果是因为看到经济疲软、并且认为有必要开始实施宽松的货币政策而降息，对于对经济状况更敏感的小盘股来说，降息的好处就没那么大了。”
  盈利
  最近，市场对小盘股盈利增长的预期一直在升温，至少对标普小盘股600指数中质量较高的成份股来说是这样。
  美银全球研究(Bank of America Global Research)的数据显示，标普小盘股600指数成分股的盈利同比增速将从今年晚些时候开始超过大盘股，这一趋势将持续到2025年。如果这种乐观情绪消退，小盘股可能就无法保持目前的涨势。
  Comerica Wealth Management首席投资官约翰·林奇(John Lynch)说：“周期股、价值股和小盘股必须证明自己的盈利增长确实在扩大，否则我们看到的将只是一轮‘晚周期'上涨行情，而不是其他东西。”
  但从现在到上述股票证明自己的盈利增长确实在扩大的这段时间里，轮动交易有可能“脱轨”，如果科技“七巨头”中其他几家公司的财报能够打动投资者，可能会吸引投资者再次涌入超大盘股，另一方面，如果它们的财报未能达到投资者的高预期，超大盘股的抛售可能会变得更加严重。
  瑞银全球财富管理(UBS Global Wealth Management)美洲资产配置主管杰森·德拉霍(Jason Draho)说：“科技股的财报能否足以重振投资者的信心？投资者将关注它们的财报，以及和预期相比财报的表现怎么样。”
  到目前为止，投资者一直在用脚投票。Alphabet (GOOGL)和特斯拉(TSLA)公布财报后股价大幅下挫，其他超大盘科技股也受到了拖累。
  “特朗普交易”
  许多受益于“大轮动”的股票也被卷入了“特朗普交易”。
  策略师们指出，如果特朗普再次入主白宫，政府政策可能更加利好市值较小、更专注于美国国内市场的公司。
  美银全球研究的林奇认为，与此同时，特朗普对台湾和大型科技公司的激进言论，再加上他的贸易保护主义议程，可能会进一步损害许多从人工智能繁荣中受益的股票。
  雷诺兹说，民主党新总统候选人的政策立场仍然是一个未知数，这又增加了一层不确定性。
  到最后可能要看参众两院控制权的归属。NorthEnd Private Wealth首席投资官亚历克斯·麦格拉思(Alex McGrath)指出，“分裂政府”将倾向于维持现状。
  麦格拉思说：“我们认为，参众两院控制权的归属是最大的未知因素。”
  （本文内容仅供参考，不构成任何形式的投资和金融建议；市场有风险，投资须谨慎。）
  本文来自微信公众号 “巴伦中文” ，作者：郭力群，36氪经授权发布。
  该文观点仅代表作者本人，36氪平台仅提供信息存储空间服务。
  巴伦周刊
  参与评论
  评论千万条，友善第一条
  登录 后参与讨论
  提交评论

stories.title: 美股“大轮动”能否持续，取决于这三件事

en.body:
The Bahrain weekly : The rate cut is just one of the factors that could undermine the “summer summer of small stocks.” The U.S. stock market under Great Rotation is changing, but will that trend continue? Or is it only a matter of time when big technology stocks return to the top?
Earlier in July, the sharp decline in the major stock index, such as the NNDA, was sharply lower, while stocks of small stocks, more sensitive to interest-rate changes, and other stocks were in a recession.
The small-cap stock index, the 2000 Rosin 2000, the S&P mid-term index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which has been winning the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq composite index, and the biggest winning streak in years, are seen as the first
"The summer of the small plate."
After that, "the big wheel" is still in some way still. The Dow Jones Market Data shows that on July 23, 10 trading days, Rosen 2000 won the S&P 500 index. Eight percentage points, the record is the highest 10 days of winning.
Last week the S&P 500 index fell 0. Eight percent and the index is down 2. 1 % and the d. 0. S&P stock rose 600% by 75 %. 6%.
Last week's US stock rally
Whether the "big-wheeler" beneficiary can keep up with the recent gains or go further, depends on the following three factors.
The reason the Fed’s Interest Rates
Stocks that were up for the stock market before the summer came to a close: big tech and other super-cap stocks have become expensive, and small, medium-sized and value stocks are cheap.
But Mike Reynolds, vice president of investment strategy, said the Great Wheel needed a catalyst at the time. After the US CPI data released on July 11, investors raised expectations for a year-long interest rate cut.
According to the Chicago Goods Exchange Group, traders now believe that the Fed is likely to cut rates six times before August 2025.
The last month, the rate has been rising dramatically.
Whether the Fed will really cut rates so many times could have a profound impact on small-cap stocks by the end of the year, but it is important not only to pay the rate, but also to the cause of the rate cut.
"The Fed's interest rate cuts are important because of the fact that it is not so much good for small stocks that are more sensitive to the economy if they see the economy weak and think it is necessary to start implementing a loose monetary policy," he said. "
Profit
Recently, expectations for a profit growth in small-cap stocks have been warming, at least for the high-quality component of the S&P 600 index.
The 600-stock dividend growth of S&P 600 shares will begin to exceed the stock's overall share later this year, according to Bank of America Global Research, which will continue to grow to 2025. If that optimism fades, the stock market may not be able to keep up with the current rise.
"The cycle, value and stock must prove that their earnings are indeed growing, otherwise we will see only a 'night cycle' going to rise, not something else," said John Lynch, chief investment officer for Comerica Wealth Management. "
But from now on, stocks have shown that their earnings are indeed growing at a time when the wheel trade could “reel off,” and if the financial news from several other tech giants could trigger investors, it could attract investors to a new
"Is the financial returns of the technology unit sufficient to boost investor confidence? Investors will focus on their financial statements and how they are expected to do," said Jason Draho, head of the American asset allocation for UBS Global Wealth Management. "
So far, investors have been voting on their feet. Other super-cap tech stocks have been hit by a sharp fall in shares after the announcement of the financial statements.
“The Trump Deal.”
Many stocks that benefited from “big wheels” were also involved in Trump’s trade.
If Trump were to return to the White House, government policies could be better for smaller and more focused companies in the US domestic market, strategists say.
Meanwhile, Trump's radical remarks about Taiwan and big technology companies, along with his trade-protection agenda, could further undermine many stocks benefiting from artificial intelligence boom, according to Lynch, a global study of the Bank.
Mr. Reynolds said the policy position of the Democratic new presidential candidate remains unknown, adding to a level of uncertainty.
The Senate may eventually have to see the ownership of both houses. Alex McGrath, chief investment officer for North End Private Wealth, said the “divisional government” would tend to maintain the status quo.
"We believe that the ownership of the two houses is the biggest unknown factor," says Ms McGrath. "
(The content of this article is for reference only, and does not constitute any form of investment and financial advice; The market is risky and investment needs to be cautious. )

stories.body:
Este año los mercados han registrado una volatilidad constante. (Infobae)

Sesión adversa para el Hang Seng (Hong Kong), que inaugura la sesión del martes 30 de julio con leves descensos del 0,46%, hasta los 17.158,86 puntos, tras el inicio de la sesión de apertura. En cuanto a los cambios de este día con respecto a días pasados, el Hang Seng (Hong Kong) pone fin a dos sesiones de racha positiva.

Teniendo en cuenta los últimos siete días, el Hang Seng (Hong Kong) marca un descenso del 1,78%%, de modo que desde hace un año aún mantiene una bajada del 9,35%. El Hang Seng (Hong Kong) se sitúa un 12,62% por debajo de su máximo del presente año (19.636,22 puntos) y un 14,69% por encima de su valoración mínima en lo que va de año (14.961,18 puntos).

Índices bursátiles… ¿Para qué?

Un índice bursátil es un indicador que deja ver cómo se modifica el valor de un un conjunto de activos, por lo que necesita contar con datos de varias compañías o sectores de una parte del mercado.

Estos indicadores son utilizados principalmente por las bolsas de valores de los países y cada uno de ellos pueden integrarse por empresas con características determinadas como podría ser contar con una capitalización bursátil similar o pertenecer a la misma industria, además, hay algunos índices que sólo toman en cuenta un puño de acciones para determinar su valor u otras que consideran cientos de acciones.

Los índices bursátiles sirven como indicador de confianza en el mercado de valores, la confianza empresarial, la salud de la economía nacional y global y el rendimiento de las inversiones en acciones y participaciones de una compañía. Generalmente, si los inversionistas no tienen confianza, los costos de las acciones tienden a caer.

Asimismo, funcionan para medir el rendimiento de un gestor de activos y permiten a los inversores analizar comparaciones entre la rentabilidad y el riesgo; medir las oportunidades de un activo financiero o crear carteras.

Este tipo de indicadores comenzaron a utilizarse a finales del siglo XIX luego de que el periodista Charles H. Dow. observara con detenimiento cómo las acciones de las empresas tendían a subir o bajar juntas de precio, por lo que creó dos índices: uno que contenía a las 20 compañías ferroviarias más importantes (pues era la industria más importante de la época), así como 12 acciones de otros tipos de negocios

Hoy en día en nuestra economía existen diversos índices y pueden agruparse en función de su geografía, los sectores, el tamaño de las empresas o también el tipo de activo, por ejemplo, el índice estadounidense del Nasdaq está compuesto por las 100 mayores compañías en gran medida relacionadas a la tecnologías como Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Facebook (FB), Alphabet (GOOG), Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), PayPal (PYPL), Comcast (CMCSA), Adobe (ADBE).

¿Cómo se calcula y cómo leerlos?

Cada índice bursátil posee su propia forma de calcularse, pero el principal componente es la capitalización bursátil de cada empresa que lo integra. Este se saca al multiplicar el valor del día del título en la bolsa correspondiente por el total de participaciones que están en circulación en el mercado.

Las firmas que se encuentran en la bolsa de valores están obligadas a presentar un balance de su composición. Dicho informe debe entregarse cada tres o seis meses, según corresponda.

Leer un índice bursátil también implica analizar sus cambios en el tiempo. Los índices actuales siempre dan inicio con un valor fijo basado en los precios de los valores en su fecha de inicio, pero no todos siguen este método. Por ende, puede dar paso a inexactitudes.

Si un índice crece 500 puntos en una jornada, mientras que otro solo consigue 20, podría parecer que el primero tuvo una rentabilidad mejor. Sin embargo, si el primero comenzó el día en 30.000 puntos y el otro en 300, se puede deducir que, en términos porcentuales, las ganancias para el segundo fueron más importantes.

¿Cuáles son los principales índices bursátiles?

Entre los principales índices bursátiles de Estados Unidos está el Dow Jones Industrial Average, mejor conocido como Dow Jones, compuesto por 30 compañías. De igual manera, el S&P 500, que engloba a 500 de las mayores empresas de la Bolsa de Nueva York. Por último, hay que mencionar el Nasdaq 100, que vincula a 100 de las mayores firmas no financieras.

Por otro lado, los índices más destacados de Europa son el Eurostoxx 50, que abarca las 50 empresas más importantes de la eurozona. Por otro lado, el DAX 30, principal índice alemán que contiene a las compañías más destacadas de la Bolsa de Fráncfort; la FTSE 100 de la Bolsa de Londres; el CAC 40 de la Bolsa de París; y el IBEX 35, de la bolsa española.

En Asia, los principales índices bursátiles son el Nikkei 225, compuesto por las 225 empresas más importantes de la bolsa de valores de Tokio. Se encuentra, además, el SSE Composite Index, es visto como el más sólido de China, conformado por las compañías más relevantes de la Bolsa de Shanghái. De igual manera, cabe mencionar el Hang Seung Index en Hong Kong y el KOSPI en Corea del Sur.

En lo que respecta a la región latinoamericana, se tiene el IPC, que contiene a las 35 firmas más sobresalientes de la Bolsa Mexicana de Valores (BMV). Al menos un tercio de ellas pertenecen al capital del magnate Carlos Slim.

Otro es el Bovespa, compuesto por las 50 empresas más importantes de la bolsa de Sao Paulo; el Merval de Argentina; el IPSA de Chile; el MSCI COLCAP de Colombia; el IBC de Caracas, conformado por 6 compañías de Venezuela.

Finalmente, existen otro tipo de índices bursátiles globales como el MSCI Latin America, que incluye las 137 empresas más importantes de Brasil, Chile, Colombia, México y Perú.

De igual forma, está el MSCI World, que incluye a 1600 compañías de 23 países desarrollados; el MSCI Emerging Markets, compuesto por más de 800 empresas de países en desarrollo; y el S&P Global 100, conformado por las 100 firmas multinacionales más poderosas de todo el planeta.

Hoy en día en nuestra economía existen diversos índices y pueden agruparse en función de su geografía, los sectores, el tamaño de las empresas o también el tipo de activo, por ejemplo, el índice estadounidense del Nasdaq está compuesto por las 100 mayores compañías en gran medida relacionadas a la tecnologías como Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Facebook (FB), Alphabet (GOOG), Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), PayPal (PYPL), Comcast (CMCSA), Adobe (ADBE).

Estos indicadores son utilizados principalmente por las bolsas de valores de los países y cada uno de ellos pueden integrarse por empresas con características determinadas como podría ser contar con una capitalización bursátil similar o pertenecer a la misma industria, además, hay algunos índices que sólo toman en cuenta un puño de acciones para determinar su valor u otras que consideran cientos de acciones.

stories.title: El mercado de Hong Kong abre la jornada con tendencia en terreno negativo este 30 de julio

en.body:
This year, markets have recorded constant volatility. (Infobage)

The contrary session for the Hang Seng (Hong Kong), which opens the session on Tuesday, July 30, with a slight decrease of 0.46%, up to 17,158.86 points, following the opening session. As for the changes of this day with regard to the past days, the Hang Seng (Hong Kong) puts an end to two positive race sessions.

Given the last seven days, the Hang Seng (Hong Kong) has been marking a 1.78% decline, so that for a year now it has been holding a 9.35% decline. The Hang Seng (Hong Kong) is 12.62% below its maximum of this year (19,636.22 points) and 14.69% above its minimum year-over-year valuation (14.961.18 points).

Blossary index... for what?

A stock index is an indicator that lets you see how the value of a set of assets is changed, so you need to have data from several companies or sectors of a part of the market.

These indicators are used mainly by the stock exchanges of countries and each of them can be integrated into companies with specific characteristics as they could be similar stock-capitalisation or belong to the same industry, and there are also some indicators that and only take into account a handful of actions to determine their value or other actions that they consider hundreds of shares.

Stock exchange rates serve as a indicator of confidence in the stock market, business confidence, the health of the national and global economy and the return of investments in shares and shares of a company. Generally, if investors don’t have confidence, the costs of the shares tend to fall.

They also work to measure the performance of an asset manager and allow investors to analyze comparisons between profitability and risk; measure the opportunities of a financial asset or create portfolios.

This type of indicators began to be used at the end of the 19th century after journalist Charles H. Dow. carefully observe how the companies’ actions tend to rise or fall price combinations, so it created two indicators: one containing the 20 most important railway companies (because it was the most important industry of the time), as well as 12 shares of other

Today, there are various indicators in our economy and can be grouped according to their geography, sectors, corporate size or also the type of asset, for example, the American Nasdaq index is composed of the 100 largest companies that are largely Ecology such as Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Facebook (FB), Alphabet (GOOG), Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), PayPal (PYPL), Comcast (CMSA), Adobe (ADBE).

How is it calculated and how to read them?

Each stock index has its own way of calculating, but the main component is the stock-capitalisation of each company that integrates it. This is done by multiplying the value of the day of the title in the relevant stock exchange for the total of shares that are in circulation on the market.

The signatures on the stock exchange are obliged to present a balance of their composition. The report must be delivered every three or six months, as appropriate.

Reading a stock index also involves analysing its changes in time. Current indices always start with a fixed value based on the values on their starting date, but not everyone follows this method. So you can make a difference.

If one index grows 500 points in one day, while another only achieves 20, it might seem that the first one had a better profitability. However, if the first one started at 30,000 points and the other in 300, it can be deduced that, in percentage terms, the gains for the second were more important.

What are the main stock index?

Among the major US stock index is the Dow Jones Industrial Average, best known as Dow Jones, consisting of 30 companies. Similarly, the S&P 500, which includes 500 of the largest companies in the New York Stock Exchange. Finally, we must mention the Nasdaq 100, which links up to 100 of the largest non-financial signatures.

On the other hand, Europe’s most prominent indices are Eurostox 50, which covers the 50 most important companies in the eurozone. On the other hand, the DAX 30, the main German index that contains the most prominent companies in the Frankfurt Stock Exchange; the FTSE 100 of the London Stock Exchange; the CAC 40 of the Paris Stock Exchange; and the IBEX 35, of the Spanish stock exchange.

In Asia, the main stock index is the Nikei 225, which is made up of the 225 most important companies in Tokyo's stock exchange. The SSE Component Index is also seen as China’s most robust, consisting of the most relevant Shanghai Stock Exchange companies. Similarly, the Hang Seung Index in Hong Kong and the KOSPI in South Korea can be mentioned.

As far as the Latin American region is concerned, there is the IPC, which contains the 35 most outstanding signatures of the Mexican Stock Exchange (BMV). At least one third of them belong to the capital of the magnet Carlos Slim.

Another is the Bovespa, which is made up of the 50 most important companies in the Sao Paulo stock exchange; the Argentina Mercal; the Ipsa of Chile; the MSCI COLCAP of Colombia; the IBC of Caracas, composed of six Venezuelan companies.

Finally, there is another type of global stock exchange rate such as the MSCI Latin America, which includes the 137 most important companies in Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Mexico and Peru.

Similarly, there is the MSCI World, which includes 1,600 companies from 23 developed countries; the MSCI Emerging Markets, consisting of more than 800 companies from developing countries; and the S&P Global 100, consisting of the 100 most powerful multinational firms
en.title: Hong Kong market opens the day with negative trend on July 30

stories.body:
By Therese Poletti

Jensen Huang indicates Meta may be one of Nvidia's biggest customers

Jensen Huang and Mark Zuckerberg, the co-founders and CEOs of Nvidia Corp. and Meta Platforms Inc., respectively, sat down for a chat at a computer-graphics conference Monday, and Huang indicated that Meta may be one of the biggest consumers of Nvidia's chips to date.

Huang, who joked in the Q&A with Zuckerberg at SIGGRAPH 2024 in Denver that they were among the rare company founders still standing in Silicon Valley, said he believed that Meta (META) has about 600,000 Nvidia (NVDA) graphics processor units (GPUs) now installed across its servers in data centers.

"The thing that is incredible - these systems you guys build, giant systems, incredibly hard to run - you said you got into the GPU journey later than most, but you are operating larger than just about everybody," Huang said to Zuckerberg.

Zuckerberg agreed. "We are good customers," he said, and joked, "That's how you get the Jensen Q&A at SIGGRAPH."

In April, Meta raised its capital-expenditures plans, telling Wall Street it would spend between $35 billion to $40 billion on AI research, data centers and other infrastructure costs, a jump from a previous forecast of $30 billion to $37 billion.

Zuckerberg talked vehemently about keeping platforms open and advocated for open-source development - not for altruistic purposes, but for the best development results. He also talked about how both consumers and businesses will soon be able to create individual AI agents for special purposes.

He added that Meta's smart glasses will evolve with more technologies, beyond today's camera and microphone. "Even with the [current-model] Ray-Bans we cannot fit all the technology we want. In next few years we will get closer," Zuckerberg said, adding that eventual display-less AI glasses at $300 "are going to be a really big product."

He also gave kudos to Huang for Nvidia continuing to focus on high-performance computing, while most other companies turned their focus to mobile computing and smaller devices.

"It's been fun watching you guys," Zuckerberg said. "Everything is moving to these devices, and you guys kept plugging away."

"We went the other way...super unfashionable," Huang said. "And now it is cool."

At the end of the hour, the two, who discussed how they have made Philly cheesesteak sandwiches for dinner in the past together, swapped jackets, with Huang giving Zuckerberg a new leather jacket just given to him by his wife, Lori, while Zuckerberg brought out a sherpa-lined black leather jacket for Huang.

Investors will be looking for any updates on Meta's spending on GPUs and other infrastructure costs when the company reports quarterly earnings Wednesday. Until then, Zuckerberg at least has a nice leather jacket, noting that the gift from his tech bro Huang was "more valuable because it was used."

-Therese Poletti

This content was created by MarketWatch, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. MarketWatch is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

07-29-24 2157ET

Copyright (c) 2024 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

sentences:
By Therese Poletti

Jensen Huang indicates Meta may be one of Nvidia's biggest customers

Jensen Huang and Mark Zuckerberg, the co-founders and CEOs of Nvidia Corp. and Meta Platforms Inc., respectively, sat down for a chat at a computer-graphics conference Monday, and Huang indicated that Meta may be one of the biggest consumers of Nvidia's chips to date.

Huang, who joked in the Q&A with Zuckerberg at SIGGRAPH 2024 in Denver that they were among the rare company founders still standing in Silicon Valley, said he believed that Meta (META) has about 600,000 Nvidia (NVDA) graphics processor units (GPUs) now installed across its servers in data centers.

"

At the end of the hour, the two, who discussed how they have made Philly cheesesteak sandwiches for dinner in the past together, swapped jackets, with Huang giving Zuckerberg a new leather jacket just given to him by his wife, Lori, while Zuckerberg brought out a sherpa-lined black leather jacket for Huang.

"The thing that is incredible - these systems you guys build, giant systems, incredibly hard to run - you said you got into the GPU journey later than most, but you are operating larger than just about everybody," Huang said to Zuckerberg.

Until then, Zuckerberg at least has a nice leather jacket, noting that the gift from his tech bro Huang was "more valuable because it was used.

stories.title: Nvidia and Meta CEOs trade praise during AI tech-bro chat at graphics show

stories.body:
·  7-min read  In this article:  KO  We recently compiled a report on the 17 Home Businesses Retirees Can Start For Supplemental Income and in this article we will look at the best business idea.
 Retirees Who Started Successful Businesses
  Starting a business as a retiree is challenging, however, more and more people are stepping into entrepreneurship after retirement to make extra income. Previously on the best small business ideas for senior citizens , we reported that people between the ages of 55 and 64 made up 22.8% of the entrepreneurs in the United States. Moreover, the number of people over 60 is expected to double by 2050 from 2015, meaning more people in this age bracket are likely to become entrepreneurs.
  Ananas Anam, a recycling business, upcycles pineapple leaves to make sustainable vegan textiles including Pinatex and Pinayarn. The company was founded by Dr Carmen Hijosa in 2013 at the age of 61. She also publishes a monthly newsletter covering news and opportunities for impact entrepreneurs. Another aspiring entrepreneur, Jim Butenschoen, works in the beauty industry. He spent 24 years working in the corporate sector before he decided to run his own business. He opened his beauty academy, Career Academy of Hair Design, at age 57. He set up 5 campuses across Northwest Arkansas and the River Valley. These schools help people develop skills, knowledge, and expertise to establish a career in the cosmetology industry.
  Now that we have studied some entrepreneurs who retired after serving their workplace for a good amount of time, let's take a look at some entrepreneurs who retired early to enjoy their hobbies freely. On June 16, Business Insider uncovered the story of Amy Porterfield, a 47-year-old entrepreneur, who started her social media consultancy at 31. She worked a 9 to 5 job as a content developer for Tony Robbins for almost 7 years before she realized she wanted to have the freedom to work as she pleased. She made $1 million in revenue in her third year of business and, in 2023, her company's revenue reached $20 million.
  Story continues
  On May 29, Business Insider quoted the story of Jean Kang, a former employee at Meta, Linkedin, Intuit, Figma, and Pinterest. For the past two years, she has been working at Figma as a strategic program manager making almost $300,000 a year. While working in big tech had been her dream for long, she eventually got tired of the hustle culture. In February this year, she decided to quit her job and pursue her entrepreneurial journey. She became a content creator and full-time career coach at the age of 31. She is expected to exceed six figures in earnings by the end of 2024.
  How to Set up a Business from Home as a Retiree
  Setting up a side business may be challenging for a retired individual. Starting a consultancy business is one of the best home businesses retirees can start for supplemental income. According to Mordor Intelligence, the consultancy industry is expected to grow to $444.72 billion by 2029 at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 4.81%. As a retiree, access to resources may be difficult, therefore considering buying a franchise may be one of the best options. Transworld Business Advisors is a consultancy franchise that has sold more than 15,000 franchise units so far. To become a part of the franchise, budding entrepreneurs must have a net worth of $150,000. The minimum cash required to start a franchise is $100,000 with a franchise fee of $65,000.
  Tutoring is another suitable business idea for retirees. Club Z! is a tutoring franchise that offers online and in-home tutoring to writers, readers, college students, and pre-k students. Every franchise has an average enrollment of 46 students per month and almost 400 locations. According to data by Top Franchise, franchisees must have a net worth of at least $100,000 and may have to invest $35,000 to start the franchise. Also, franchisees must pay a fee of almost $20,000 to $35,000 and have at least $40,000 in liquid cash. You can also take a look at the most profitable businesses to start from home in 2024
  Sit Back and Enjoy Your Retirement Using Dividend Earnings
  Starting a business may not be everyone's cup of tea. Instead, retirees may also consider investing in dividend stocks. Amancio Ortega Gaona is an investor with a net worth of $110.3 billion, as of July 30. Based in Spain, he is one of the richest people in the world and is best known as the owner of the fashion giant Zara. He owns 60% of Inditex, home to 8 brands and 7,500 stores worldwide, and makes almost $400 million in dividends every year. His dividends are primarily invested in real estate in Spain, the United Kingdom, and the United States.
  Some of the best dividend stocks for passive income include The Coca-Cola Company (NYSE: KO ). Warren Buffett, chairman and CEO of Berkshire Hathaway, invested $1.3 billion in The Coca-Cola Company (NYSE:KO) in 1994. Today, he owns almost 400 million shares of KO worth $24.7 billion. In 1994, Warren Buffet received $75 million in cash dividends from Coca-Cola. Fast forward to 2023, he made almost $736 million and is on track to receive $776 million in 2024, a yield of nearly 59.7% from his original investment of $1.3 billion.
  The Coca-Cola Company (NYSE:KO) is not only a dividend payer, but also a dividend grower. The company has grown its dividends by 3.65% over the past 5 years and has a payout ratio of 68.32%. The company has grown its dividends consistently for 61 years and paid out $8 billion in dividends in 2023. With almost 4.3 billion shares outstanding and a dividend at $1.94 per share, the company is expected to pay $8.4 billion in dividends in 2024. As of July 29, the stock has a forward dividend yield of 1.98%.
  Now that we have studied some successful business owners, let's take a look at the 17 home businesses retirees can start for supplemental income. You can also read our piece on the most profitable small business ideas to start in 2024
  The Best Home Business Retirees Can Start For Supplemental Income
  An elderly couple in a garden with a laptop, representing how the company empowers its customers to make the best retirement and tax-deferred investment decisions.
  Our Methodology
  To gather a list of the 17 home businesses retirees can start for supplemental income, we consulted threads on Reddit and over 10 rankings and reports on the internet. We picked the business ideas that appeared in 50% of our sources and then ranked them.
  The Best Home Business Retirees Can Start For Supplemental Income
  1. Asset Utilization
  Utilizing your assets is one of the best ideas for retirees looking for supplemental income. Retirees can utilize their assets to either invest in property or stocks or become dividend investors. Blue chip stocks like The Coca-Cola Company (NYSE:KO) offer generous dividends to their investors. The company has grown its dividend by almost 3.7% over the past 5 years, has a healthy payout ratio of 68.3%, and paid out almost $8 billion in dividends in 2023. Warren Buffet is one of the greatest dividend investors who made $736 billion in dividends for the year ended 2023. Amancio Ortega Gaona, a dividend investor who owns 60% of Inditex, approximately makes $400 million in dividends every year. On the other hand, if retirees own some property they may consider renting it for business or commercial use or they may sell it to invest the cash elsewhere.
  Curious to explore other business ideas? Check out our report on the 17 Home Businesses Retirees Can Start For Supplemental Income
  At Insider Monkey, we delve into a variety of topics; however, our expertise lies in identifying the top performing stocks. Currently, Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology stands out as one of the most promising fields. If you are looking for an AI stock that is more promising than NVDA but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock
  READ NEXT: Analyst Sees a New $25 Billion “Opportunity” for NVIDIA and Jim Cramer is Recommending These 10 Stocks in June
  Disclosure: None. This article is originally published on Insider Monkey
